name: Kumarakom Lake Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently spent four weeks travelling in India. The first two weeks around Delhi, Agra, Jaipur and the Rajasthan countryside. Then on to Kerala, which was wonderful. The final week at Kumarakom Lake Resort was ideal. The situation is so peaceful with the infinity pool overlooking the lake. Staff were excellent and very helpful. We stayed in a Heritage Villa, beautiffully furnished and comfotable, with its own small pool, but close to the infinity pool. Both restaurants served excellent food but the seafood restaurant produced some of the best fish we have ever eaten. We also spent one night on a hotel houseboat - a lovely restful experience. A terrific place to relax and end a holiday.
reviews.title: Great spot to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived from a 2 hour journey, receptionist not very welcoming, had a pool villa with lake view that was great but the pool area was small and took over the whole area so probably better to use the main pool, which we did. Room well appointed. They have 2 restaurants, predominately buffet where you have breakfast, nice staff and Indian families like to eat there both at lunch times and evenings. We prefer al la carte and more of an adult ambience so used the seafood grill. Utter rubbish cocktails the first night, then we found out that they had hardly any stocks left of European wine, they like to push you toward Indian wine that we are not that fond of. However, the food and beverage manager was called and thereafter he was brilliant, checked on us regularly and the food we had for all 3 meals each day were great. The location and cleanliness is perfect, the pool is probably one of the nicest we have had in India, however, the service around the pool was non existent, they were vague about serving any food there and one day we witness a dirty coffee cup on a dirty pool table that was there from 4pm one night to midday the next day. All in all we thought it was excellent, there were quite a few children and I think Indian families are perhaps more indulgent with their children than British families, so it could get rather loud around the pool and in the Etukettu restaurant, also, they let the children eat breakfast in nightwear even though there were signs forbidding this - strange behaviour. The hotel rice barges are amazing, our travel agent booked us with another company, big mistake, ALWAYS use the hotel boats. Great place, away from all the other hotels but Mr Sree made it for us, he was professional and determined to bring this place and the staff up to scratch.
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION AND THEY TRY SO HARD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed here for one night after a night on a rice boat but it was lovely. The location is perfect & our accomodation, with patio & steps down into a pool, was perfect. All the staff where most attentive. A great place to stay & relax.
reviews.title: Beautiful tranquillity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were greeted graciously by the staff and while our room was not ready, taken to the beautiful restaurant overlooking the lake...not a bad place to be! The GM and staff welcomed up with a wonderful lunch. Our room was just beautiful and truly a one of a kind experience with the pool at our footsteps. The spa was out of this world...to day, my husband and I have never had such a great experience. We ended our trip with a night on one of the house boats; this was a must! Overall, this was a great place to start our honeymoon and we would recommend to anyone and everyone. Happy travels!
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in their meandering pool villa. Tastefully designed, impeccably clean, friendly & helpful staffs, sinfully tasty food, loads of activity, relaxing & rejuvenating spa & loads of time with your loved one!! Those interested in details, just READ ONN….
reviews.title: Treat to the body & soul!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort sits on the shores of Vembanad Lake.
reviews.title: Lovely lakeside resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: There are two room selections: one is the pool side rooms, the other the garden rooms.
reviews.title: A super relaxing rejuvinating experiance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Depending on your likes and dislikes, the pool side rooms all have private access to the vast meandering pool system.. Simply step out of your door and walk into the pool.
reviews.title: Impressive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The bathroom is outside the main bedroom (fully walled and private) but comes complete with banana tree!
reviews.title: Recommended: It made my holiday pleasant and relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is also a series of canals through the hotel grounds where you can try your hand at fishing. As we were told, 'Just ask the coconut boy for a rod'.
reviews.title: Gone are its glory days... and how!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Kumarkom where one can feel silence and greenery with good food,service and hospitality. hotel is on very nice location.you can see sun set from this location.their evening attraction is tea stole their style of making tea and coffee is unique.
reviews.title: RIGHTLY SAID THAT PERHAPS THE ONLY PARADISE ON EARTH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had planned a holiday for four days and were looking for a perfect retreat to rejuvenate. We had our first kid four months ago and were keen to take our baby along, who is five months old. We were looking for a infant friendly place with a good spa.
reviews.title: Great retreat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was skeptical when our agent suggested klr. The reason .. The place was a two hour drive from the nearest Cochin (Kochi) airport, and it did not figure in the current lists of top 10 spa hotels of India. However, after evaluating several options, we decided to give it a try. We opted for a 3 nights rejuvenation package with full board.
reviews.title: Loved the infinity swimming pool overlooking the vembanad lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We departed from our home town of Bengaluru for Kochi by the late morning Kingfisher flight. We landed an hour late. It was nice to find our pickup waiting at the arrival hall. We were glad to find that klr had sent in a spacious and comfortable Inova to take us to the hotel. I'm giving full points to klr for tracking our delayed flight and sending a good car. Klr seams to have aptly overcome its locational disadvantage. The two hour ride was smooth and baby Amartya decided to take a nap for most part of the ride.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel with nice lake view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were well received at the hotel and escorted to our room. We find the room clean and comfortable. The wash room is well maintained and has a spacious Jacuzzi. On or request klr provided a oriental crib for baby Amartya. The property has a nature all around and even has a artificial canal running in between.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not stay in the resort, but were impressed with the welcome we received from the hotel and the efficiency of the arrangements made for us to experience two nights on a private cruise of the lake and its backwaters. With our crew of three and all our needs catered for, we felt very privileged and entirely at ease. The backwaters - particularly the more remote sections - were fascinating and provided a shifting panorama of life and wildlife along the waterways. We also made some interesting 'landfalls' along the way escorted by one of our crew members. As a conclusion to an incredible but active 3 weeks in both north and south India, this was a gentle and relaxing way of bringing our holiday to a reflective conclusion.
reviews.title: All along the Backwaters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have always had a longing to visit the Kerala backwaters. The 2 nights at Kumarakom satisfied all. A lovely property on the lake front. Loved the pool area and all the extras offered by the hotel, the sunset cruise and the afternoon tea on the lake front. I had a wonderful Meen fish curry, the guide said the fish restaurant was expensive, but I thought great value.
reviews.title: It was all I had hoped for my Kerala backwater experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the hotel rooms, would have liked a room in the gardens to enjoy the view. Also don't know why the spa in bathroom was filled with water, we didn't use. I think a waste of space. Again rooms need a little work, but nothing to stop great enjoyment.
reviews.title: Idyllic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though a malayalee ,never experienced the lakeside beauty of Kerala quite like this before.The location is excellent, and rooms spread out across the extensive landscaped gardens and small meandering water canals.It was a totally refreshing 3 days with sumptuous meals and exceptionally great service.The rooms and the private pools are well equipped.We had got the lakeview villa near to infinity pool which also gave us an impeccable sunset view from the room.Even the sunset cruise with music is a great experience. The only thing which i would suggest is to include internet in the room charges.Otherwise an excellent stay and I would definitely come back to this resort, and would be happy to recommend it to anybody.
reviews.title: Excellent for non malayalees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about the Hotel is worth praising provided I was not a malayalee. The entire resort is set up in a traditional Kerala style. Foreigners can get a feel of the place by staying in KLR for a night. I certainly enjoyed my stay there but it was no change from my daily life.
reviews.title: My anniversary was made very special

description: Kerala's leading resort by the side of famous Vembanadu lake, the largest backwaters of Kerala, located north of Kumarakom. An ideal backwater resort for honeymoon holidays, leisure holidays, family vacation, etc. All the villas are centrally air conditioned - There are 7 lake view heritage villa with plunge pools, 15 Heritage Garden view Villas with plunge pools, 26 meandering Pool Villas, 9 Luxury Pavillion Rooms with heated Jacuzzi, 2 Presidential Suite with private Pool and 4 Air conditioned House boats with 7 rooms. Air conditioned Conference hall with 85 Pax theatre style seating facility available. 100 seater restaurant with traditional Kerala architecture, 45 seater seafood restaurant with bar available. Kerala's traditional Ayurveda, Yoga, and backwater cruise facility available. The entire resort is Wi-Fi enabled.
